comments:
Happened during regression test of 3.2.i2 when running manual test suite in 
CVS: 
org.eclipse.hyades.tests/org.eclipse.hyades.test.java.tests/manual/AllTests.tes
tsuite.

When opening a JUnit test execution result, eclipse crashed. But was not able 
to reproduce after that.

Error caught in log:

Suggestion:
This happens when SWT fails to create a menu item and throws an error. Hyades 
should have better error handling in place instead of leave the error bubble 
up.

This is not a Hyades error, but an SWT problem due to resource limitations.  We
can try to catch this error ourselves in the framework code, but when this
problem occurs, we can not even create a dialog to alert the user of the problem
(because SWT is out of handles.)  Logging the error is probably the best
solution, and that is being done by SWT now.

Please use this defect as a placeholder to investigate what the SWT team is
doing about this problem.

Now that we have a "3.3" Version in bugzilla, updating bugzillas targeted to 3.3
or a 3.3 iteration so that their Version matches their Target. "future",
"unspecified", "4.0", and "4.1" Versions will not be updated.

From eclipse 3.1 on, plugins will be shipped as single JAR file.  One of the
advantages of this is to reduce the number of file handles (and file size) in
products based on Eclipse that have large number of plugins.  SWT is one of the
projects to make this change which should alleviate this problem.
